title: 1992 African Cup of Nations
text:
The 1992 African Cup of Nations was the 18th edition of the <a href="Africa%20Cup%20of%20Nations">Africa Cup of Nations</a>, the <a href="association%20football">football</a> championship of Africa (<a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">CAF</a>). It was hosted by <a href="Senegal">Senegal</a>. The field expanded to twelve teams, split into four groups of three; the top two teams in each group advanced to the quarterfinals. <a href="Ivory%20Coast%20national%20football%20team">Ivory Coast</a> won its first championship, beating <a href="Ghana%20national%20football%20team">Ghana</a> on <a href="penalty%20shootout%20%28football%29">penalty kicks</a> 11–10 after a goalless draw.
Qualified teams.
The 12 qualified teams are:
Venues.
The competition was played in two venues in <a href="Dakar">Dakar</a> and <a href="Ziguinchor">Ziguinchor</a>.
Knockout stage.
Final.
The penalty shootout was significant in that it was the first in the final of a major international tournament that every player on the pitch took a penalty.
CAF Team of the Tournament.
Goalkeeper
Defenders
Midfielders
Forwards
